item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it is a great triumph over Christianity." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Jack Spicer
item.description: "Most of my friends like words too well. They set them under the blinding light of the poem and try to extract every possible connotation from each of them, every temporary pun, every direct or indirect connection - as if a word could become an object by mere addition of consequences. Others pick up words from the streets, from their bars, from their offices and display them proudly in their poems as if they were shouting, "See what I have collected from the American language. Look at my butterflies, my stamps, my old shoes!" What does one do with all this crap?" -- Jack Spicer

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "What is the seal of liberation? Not to be ashamed in front of oneself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Federico García-Lorca
item.description: "I've often lost myself, in order to find the burn that keeps everything awake" -- Federico García-Lorca

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Become who you are!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Any fool can fight a winning battle, but it needs character to fight a losing one, and that should inspire us; which reminds me that I dreamed the other night that I was being hanged, but was the life and soul of the party." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "They muddy the water, to make it seem deep." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "so I wait for you like a lonely house till you will see me again and live in me. Till then my windows ache." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Everything is ceremony in the wild garden of childhood." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Love brings to light a lover's noble and hidden qualities-his rare and exceptional traits: it is thus liable to be deceptive of his normal qualities." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by John Clare
item.description: "grammar in learning is like tyranny in government - confound the bitch I'll never be her slave." -- John Clare

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "To predict the behavior of ordinary people in advance, you only have to assume that they will always try to escape a disagreeable situation with the smallest possible expenditure of intelligence." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Samuel Coleridge
item.description: "No man was ever yet a great poet, without at the same time being a profound philosopher." -- Samuel Coleridge

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The Christian resolution to find the world ugly and bad has made the world ugly and bad." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or a smile, a kind look or heartfelt compliment." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "They're so cold, these scholars! May lightning strike their food so that their mouths learn how to eat fire!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Deep thinking is attainable only by a man of deep feeling, and all truth is a species of revelation" -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "God is dead, but considering the state the species man is in, there will perhaps be caves, for ages yet, in which his shadow will be shown." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "To see him act is like reading Shakespeare by flashes of lightning." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: foster add a quote by Freidrich Neitzsche
item.description: "The desire to annoy no one, to harm no one, can equally well be the sign of a just as of an anxious disposition." -- Freidrich Neitzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Matthew Arnold
item.description: "And we forget because we must and not because we will." -- Matthew Arnold

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "As soon as a religion comes to dominate it has as its opponents all those who would have been its first disciples. " -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Matthew Arnold
item.description: "Journalism is literature in a hurry." -- Matthew Arnold

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Because we have for millenia made moral, aesthetic, religious demands on the world, looked upon it with blind desire, passion or fear, and abandoned ourselves to the bad habits of illogical thinking, this world has gradually become so marvelously variegated, frightful, meaningful, soulful, it has acquired color - but we have been the colorists: it is the human intellect that has made appearances appear and transported its erroneous basic conceptions into things." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "It is always difficult to give oneself up; few persons anywhere ever succeed in doing so, and even fewer transcend the possessive stage to know love for what it actually is: a perpetual discovery, and immersion in the waters of reality, an unending re-creation." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: foster add a quote by NIETZSCHE FREDERICH
item.description: "Every true faith is infallible. It performs what the believing person hopes to find in it. But it does not offer the least support for the establishing of an objective truth. Here the ways of men divide. If you want to achieve peace of mind and happiness, have faith. If you want to be a disciple of truth, then search." -- NIETZSCHE FREDERICH

item.title: foster add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Erotic acts are instinctive; they fulfill a role in nature. The idea is familiar, but it is one that contains a paradox: there is nothing more natural than sexual desire; there is nothing less natural than the forms in which it is made manifest and satisfied." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: foster add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Of all that is written I love only what a man has written in his own blood." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: foster add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "a silent concave of puppet buffoons neither eagles nor jaguars buzzard lawyers locuses wings of ink sawing mindibles ventriloquist coyotes peddlers of shadows beneficent satraps the cacomistle thief of hens the monument to the Rattle and its snake the altar to the mauser and the machete the mausoleum of the epauletted cayman rhetoric sculpted in phrases of cement" -- Octavio Paz
